Our Story

A little history, a lot of heart.

Since 1962

Mel's Moonlight Diner started as a tiny roadside stop on Route 9, serving truckers and travelers the best pie in the county. Mel himself — a former Navy cook with a knack for comfort food — believed that a warm meal could turn any bad day around.

Over six decades later, the neon sign still glows, the coffee's still strong, and the same family recipes are made from scratch every single day. We've grown, but the spirit hasn't changed one bit.

  • Recipes passed down through three generations
  • Locally sourced ingredients whenever possible
  • A welcoming place for everyone, every night
  • Community first — we sponsor local events year-round
